title: Do lithium ion batteries need to be fully charged before first use? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, there’s is no need to fully charge a Li-ion battery before using it. If it’s low, simply plug in a charger. If you don’t have a charger, I’d probably make sure it’s got at least 50% charge before attempting to ‘restore’ your old phones contents onto the phone, as it’s going to consume a good amount of power if you’ve got a lot of apps and data to download and it’s better to not intterupt this process (though it’s not a battery issue.)

No, Infact you can use liion battery anytime and charge anytime no need to consider charge state. Charge state of 20–80 is healthy for liion. A fully charged cell self discharges faster than partially discharged one. How to Prolong Lithium-based Batteries Liion dont have memory effect like nicd. So charge and use as you wish. Some devices like android smartphone may forget full capacity if not full charged for long time as they track watthours with the voltage. Which can be recovered by 1 or 2 complete cycles or by deleting the battery stats file. Hope this is helpfull
